Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice with trace of handle root; white slip; interior glazed black with undetermined motif in added white; below, near bottom of sherd, trace of white zigzag band; exterior: painted decoration consisting of goat (hind leg and one front hoof remaining) to right; elaborate rosette and square as filling ornament; below, in handle zone, handle frill pattern and part of double guilloche pattern between bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Goats are very rarely featured on Mature Animal Style vases.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0576) (phase 2)
